title: Liverpool win FA Cup: How Jurgen Klopp sets the tone for everything Reds do - Alan Shearer
description: There is so much to admire about FA Cup winners Liverpool at the moment, and all of it is down to one man - Jurgen Klopp, says MOTD pundit Alan Shearer.

title: Eurovision 2022: Ukraine wins, while the UK's Sam Ryder comes second
description: Ukraine's Kalush Orchestra triumphs, while Sam Ryder gives the UK its best result since 1998.

title: Bristol mum writes heart surgery book to help son
description: Aimee says the book will help her son understand why he "should be proud" of his heart surgery scar.

title: Fleeing Syria 10 years on: 'We cried all the way to Jordan'
description: A family looks back after a decade living in the world's largest Syrian refugee camp.

title: World War Two, the Belfast mountain and a white rock
description: The stone helped guide allied pilots into wartime airfields in use in Belfast during the war.

title: Covid: What will the pandemic look like in North Korea?
description: North Korea is uniquely vulnerable to the virus, and the options to control its spread are limited.

title: MOTD Rewind: Watch Son Heung-min's Puskas award-winning goal for Tottenham against Burnley
description: Watch Son Heung-min's spectacular Puskas award-winning goal for Tottenham against Burnley in 2019 from all the angles.

title: Junk food: Obesity strategy falling apart, Jamie Oliver says
description: Boris Johnson is accused of "playing politics with children's health" after delaying new restrictions.

title: Custom-made brace helps heal baby giraffe
description: Vets in San Diego, California, came up with a creative solution to treat a young calf's limb disorder.

title: Former firearms officers says £1m payout will not make up for pain
description: A former officer who was victimised while working for Police Scotland says she was failed by the force.

title: Delhi office fire: Dozens killed as fire sweeps through building
description: Most of those inside were women, leaving families frantically searching for news of their fate.

title: NUS: Government cuts students' union links over anti-Semitism concerns
description: The universities minister says the National Union of Students will not be eligible for government funding.

title: Richard Mylan: Waterloo Road star reveals heroin addiction battle
description: Actor Richard Mylan challenges the stigma of addicts in the hope more drug users seek recovery.

title: Monkeypox: Two more confirmed cases of viral infection
description: The individuals live together but are not linked to the case announced on 7 May, health agency says.

title: Shireen Abu Aqla: UN condemns killing of Al Jazeera reporter
description: Shireen Abu Aqla was shot dead in disputed circumstances in the occupied West Bank.

title: Norfolk and Norwich Festival launched with giant dominoes topple
description: Thousands lined a city's streets to watch the blocks topple over a 1.6-mile course.

title: FA Cup finals: How Chelsea culture drives success on both fronts
description: Chelsea will compete in the finals of both the men's and the women's FA Cups at Wembley this weekend - but is it something "in the water" that breeds their success?

title: North Korea: Covid outbreak a great disaster, says Kim Jong-un
description: North Korea's leader blames the outbreak on bureaucratic and medical incompetence.

title: The Papers: 'Dame in a day' and 'Coleen's split'
description: The papers cover Prince William's home visit to see Deborah James and the latest from the Wagatha Christie libel trial.

title: Boris Johnson: Fifty migrants told they will be sent to Rwanda
description: Boris Johnson says the government will "dig in for the fight" against any legal bids to block their removal.

title: Ukraine: The spy war within the war
description: The expulsion of Russian officials from Western capitals shows how the spy conflict is intensifying.

title: Why an Indian couple is suing their son over grandchildren
description: A son is duty-bound to look after parents but must he deliver grandchildren too?

title: Northern Ireland Protocol: What did Boris Johnson say?
description: Boris Johnson says the Northern Ireland Brexit deal he negotiated is "turning into a political problem".

title: East Africa drought: 'The suffering here has no equal'
description: Some 20 million people face severe hunger but aid agencies say the world's attention is on Ukraine.

title: Photos of 1900s Herefordshire life discovered hidden in cupboard
description: Richard Jenkins took the photos and his family found the negatives in a concealed cupboard.

title: Week in pictures: 7-13 May 2022
description: A selection of powerful images from all over the globe, taken in the past seven days.

title: Asteroid mining: Helping to meet Earth's natural resource demands
description: With Earth's natural resources running out, people are looking to mineral-rich asteroids to meet demand.
